entry.title: The Occupational Pensions (Revaluation) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order is made, as required by paragraph 2(1) of Schedule 3 to the Pension Schemes Act 1993, in the year beginning 1st January 2003 and specifies revaluation percentages for the purpose of the revaluation on or after 1st January 2004 of benefits under occupational pension schemes, as required by section 84 of, and Schedule 3 to, that Act.

entry.title: The Secure Training Centre (Amendment) Rules 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: SECURE TRAINING CENTRES, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SECURE TRAINING CENTRES, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Secure Training Centre Rules 1998 (S.I. 1998/472). The majority of the changes are so that certain provisions apply differently to persons detained in secure training centres who have not been convicted of an offence. Previously, it was not possible for a person who had not been convicted of an offence to be detained in a secure training centre. However, section 133 of the Criminal Justice and Police Act 2001 (c. 16) amended section 23 of the Children and Young Persons Act 1969 (c. 24) so that a person who had been remanded to local authority secure accommodation could be detained in a secure training centre, with the consent of the Secretary of State.

entry.title: Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Revocation) Order (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: This Order revokes the Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2003 which contains emergency prohibitions restricting various activities in order to prevent human consumption of scallops or food which is derived from scallops originating in waters in Strangford Lough.

entry.title: The Millennium Commission (Reduction in Membership) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order reduces the total number of members to be appointed to the Millennium Commission (established under section 40 of the National Lottery etc. Act 1993) from nine to eight.

entry.title: The Victim Statements (Prescribed Courts) (Scotland) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order prescribes the sheriff courts of Ayr, Edinburgh and Kilmarnock, and the High Court sitting at Edinburgh and Kilmarnock for the purposes of section 14(1) of the Criminal Justice (Scotland) Act 2003.

entry.title: The Education Act 2002 (Commencement No. 2 and Savings and Transitional Provisions) (Amendment No. 2) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends the Education Act 2002 (Commencement No.2 and Savings and Transitional Provisions) Order 2002 and revokes the Education Act 2002 (Commencement No. 2 and Savings and Transitional Provisions) (Amendment) Order 2003.

entry.title: The Water Environment and Water Services (Scotland) Act 2003 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force certain provisions of Part 1 of the Water Environment and Water Services (Scotland) Act 2003 on 22nd December 2003–

entry.title: The Election Against Benefits (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: Regulation 1 provides for citation, commencement and interpretation.

entry.title: The Department for Transport (Driver Licensing and Vehicle Registration Fees) Order 2003

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Department for Transport (Driver Licensing and Vehicle Registration Fees) Order 2003

entry.summary: This Order specifies the functions, the costs of which the Secretary of State may recover when setting the fees relating to driver licensing and vehicle registration. In particular it provides that he may recover costs relating to vehicle licensing when setting driver licensing fees and vice versa. It also extends the range of matters which may be taken into account in determining the costs of the specified functions.

entry.title: The Collagen and Gelatine (Intra-Community Trade) (England) (No. 2) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in relation to England only, implement in relation to England Commission Decision 2003/721/EC amending Council Directive 92/118/EEC as regards requirements for collagen intended for human consumption and repealing Decision 2003/42/EC (OJ No. L260, 11.10.2003, p.21) – “the new Decision” – so far as it relates to trade between Member States of the European Community.

entry.title: The Sustainable Energy Act 2003 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on the 28th November 2003 section 5 of the Sustainable Energy Act 2003.

entry.title: The Finance Act 2003, Part 3, (Appointed Day) Order 2003
entry.summary: This order appoints the day the relevant provisions in the Finance Act 2003 enter into force. The relevant provisions provide for the introduction of civil penalties for contraventions of European Community and national customs laws.

entry.title: The Road Vehicles (Registration and Licensing) (Amendment) (No. 3) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Road Vehicles (Registration and Licensing) Regulations 2002 to provide that a supplement is payable by the registered keeper upon late renewal of a vehicle licence. The supplement is £80, save where payment is within 28 days of the date on which the registered keeper is notified that a supplement may or has become payable, when it shall be £40 regulation 2).

entry.title: The Food (Brazil Nuts) (Emergency Control) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Food (Brazil Nuts) (Emergency Control) (England) Regulations 2003 (S.I. 2003/1722).

entry.title: The Justice (Northern Ireland) Act 2002 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Commencement Order brings into force on 1st December 2003 the provisions of the Justice (Northern Ireland) Act 2002 listed in the Schedule to this Order and on 18th December 2003 the provisions of the Justice (Northern Ireland) Act 2002 listed in Article 3(2).

entry.title: The Sustainable Energy (CHP Provisions) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order defines “the government” for the purposes of setting a CHP target pursuant to section 5(1) of the Sustainable Energy Act 2003 for England and Wales. It also specifies the circumstances, and those parts of the government, to be excluded from the estimation of the amount of electricity that the government will use in the period specified in the target.

entry.title: The New Northern Ireland Assembly Elections (Returning Officer’s Charges) (Amendment) Order 2003
entry.summary: Article 2(3) of this Order amends the Schedule to the New Northern Ireland Assembly Elections (Returning Officer’s Charges) Order 1998 by moving from Part B (Expenses of returning officers for which no maximum recoverable amounts are specified) to Part A (Expenses of returning officers for which maximum recoverable amounts are specified) expenses incurred by returning officers in relation to the count. Subsistence expenses relating to counting staff remain in Part B. Paragraph 7 of Part B is extended to include furniture necessary for the count. The Order also amends the maximum amounts specified in Part A.

entry.title: Education (Listed Bodies) Order (Northern Ireland) 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: HIGHER AND FURTHER EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT

category.term: HIGHER AND FURTHER EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT

entry.summary: This Order repeals and replaces the Education (Listed Bodies) Order (Northern Ireland) 2000.

entry.title: The Wireless Telegraphy (Licence Charges) (Amendment) (Channel Islands and Isle of Man) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Wireless Telegraphy (Licence Charges) Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/1700) (the “Principal Regulations”). These Regulations extend only to the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.

entry.title: The Local Government Pension Scheme (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2003

category.term: School links with home, community and business

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Government Pension Scheme Regulations 1997 (“the principal Regulations”) which comprise the Local Government Pension Scheme (“the Scheme”).
